body:
### Problem

Some highlights groups don't get set through `ModeChanged` autocommand don't get set immediatly when entering command-line mode.

### Steps to reproduce

Use the following `init.lua`:

```lua
local augroup = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup('TestGroup', {})
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('ModeChanged', {
  callback = function()
    vim.api.nvim_set_hl(0, 'Normal', { bg = 'green' }) -- This gets set immediatly when pressing `:`
    vim.api.nvim_set_hl(0, 'CursorLineNr', { bg = 'red' }) -- This doesn't get set until leaving command-line mode
    vim.api.nvim_set_hl(0, 'CursorLine', { bg = 'blue' }) -- Same as above
  end,
  group = augroup,
})
```

1. `nvim --clean -u path/to/init.lua`
2. Press `:`, notice how `Normal`'s `bg` gets set to `green` but the other highlights don't trigger
3. Press `<Esc>`, notice how `CursorLineNr`'s and `CursorLine`'s new highlights get set

Originally when I found this error I had the latter highlights get set after I start typing in command-line mode, but with this minimal config they don't get set until I leave command-line mode.

I'm seeing the same behaviour in Vim 9.0.2002 with the following VimScript:

```vim
set number
set cursorline

augroup TestGroup
  autocmd!
  autocmd ModeChanged * call s:ModeChanged()
augroup END

function! s:ModeChanged()
  highlight Normal ctermbg=green
  highlight CursorLineNr ctermbg=red
  highlight CursorLine ctermbg=blue
endfunction
```


### Expected behavior

All three highlights (`Normal`, `CursorLineNr` and `CursorLine`) get set immediatly upon pressing `:`.


### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1e7e9ee

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Yes, Vim 9.0.2002

### Operating system/version

Manjaro Linux x86_64

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.8.0-dev (3ed0430)

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

AUR
title: Some highlights in `ModeChanged` autocommand for command-line mode don't get set immediately on trigger
